image.altText: The Bureau of Meteorology's official cyclone tracking map.

props.synopsis: Darwin is officially on cyclone watch, with Tropical Cyclone Fina now forecast to brush past the Northern Territory capital on its way over the Tiwi Islands on Saturday.

image.altText: A boat on land.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is refusing to be drawn on how much a program to remove people from Australia's northern waters using repurposed fishing boats is costing, saying it is a legacy project.

title.children: PM says no apologies over Border Force's secret boat returnee scheme

image.altText: A woman and a man standing inside a newsroom and smiling at the camera, with television screens in the background.

props.synopsis: Some people refer to attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder as "a superpower" while others describe their ADHD symptoms as debilitating. Can both be true?

title.children: What the experts want you to know about these key ADHD symptoms

image.altText: The exterior of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: HM Air, formerly known as Heli-Muster NT, has sold all 14 of its Robinson R22 helicopters as it diversifies the business.Â

title.children: Business sells large fleet of Robinson R22 mustering helicopters

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT says it will refuse all new criminal clients who are not already in custody, including children as young as 10, due to funding constraints.

title.children: Ten-year-olds facing jail could be forced to go without a lawyer in the NT

image.altText: Ash streams kilometres into the sky from a green field

image.altText: A curly-haired man cleans a window.

props.synopsis: A multinational company is taking a small-town Australian cleaner to court, claiming his glass-cleaning product is deceptively similar to its own.

title.children: Multinational company sues small-town cleaner over packaging

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: Four containers with coloured sand inside.

props.synopsis: An after-school hours operator says an asbestos removal company wanted to charge her more than $14,000 to vacuum up a small amount of coloured sand that spilled onto carpet at a regional New South Wales primary school.

title.children: Care provider quoted $14k to remove a 'few clumps' of coloured sand

image.altText: A serious-looking man in a grey jumper speaks at a podium.

image.altText: Donald Trump walks outdoors on to a red carpet dressed in a suit.

image.altText: comet 31 atlas, a yellow looking orb moves through the solar system, the image is grainy

title.children: NASA unveils close-up pictures of Comet 3I/Atlas in our solar system

image.altText: Shepparton car thief leaves baby in a box

image.altText: A blonde woman in a pink dress looks at a woman with green skin who wears a witch's hat and holds a broomstick.

image.altText: A dark coloured hatchback with its bonnet up almost completely burnt out after it had been on fire on a street.

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, dressed in a suit, gestures as he  speaks.

props.synopsis: The federal government has begun to contact Pacific leaders to canvass a COP31 "Plan B" which would see Adelaide abandon its bid for the global United Nations climate summit so long as Pacific nations are guaranteed a role in next year's conference.
